meanings.definition: Macrofossils: Fossils that are visible to the naked eye.
meanings.sent1: During the museum tour, we saw many macrofossils of dinosaurs and plants.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study macrofossils to learn about ancient life on Earth.
meanings.sent3: The macrofossils in the exhibit seemed to be chatting with each other.
meanings.sent4: The macrofossils in the rock layers were like time capsules from the past.
meanings.sent5: The children were amazed by the size of the macrofossils displayed in the museum.

meanings.definition: Macrofossils: Remains of ancient organisms that are large enough to be seen without the aid of a microscope.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist discovered macrofossils of a prehistoric mammoth in the cave.
meanings.sent2: Macrofossils found in sedimentary rocks provide valuable information about past environments.
meanings.sent3: The macrofossils in the ground seemed to be playing hide and seek with the researchers.
meanings.sent4: The macrofossils unearthed in the excavation site whispered stories of ancient times.
meanings.sent5: The macrofossils of ancient trees were like giant puzzles waiting to be solved by scientists.
